content:
Purple-patterned spinners can be very effective for trout at Lake Tahoe! The lake's clear waters and the trout's keen eyesight can make them particularly responsive to lures with a bit of flash and color. Purple is a great choice because it's a color that's often associated with baitfish and other small prey, which trout love to feed on.

In fact, Lake Tahoe's trout are known to be particularly fond of lures with a bit of purple, pink, or red in them. These colors can help to trigger an aggressive response from trout, especially in the clearer waters of the lake.

If you found that purple-patterned spinners worked well for you last time, you may want to consider trying some other lures with similar color patterns. Some other options you might want to try include:

* Lures with a purple or pink body and a silver or gold blade
* Lures with a holographic or iridescent finish that reflects purple or pink light
* Lures with a purple or pink tail or trailer that adds a bit of flash and movement

Remember to experiment with different retrieval speeds and actions to see what works best for you. And don't be afraid to try different lures and presentations to adapt to changing water conditions and fish behavior.
